questions.question: What is a Virtual Private Server (VPS)?
questions.answer: A VPS is a server split into completely separate hosting environments. One of those environments is fully dedicated to you, meaning no shared RAM or CPU, and you're less likely to be affected by other users.

questions.question: When should I use VPS instead of shared hosting?
questions.answer: A VPS is a server split into completely separate hosting environments. One of those environments is fully dedicated to you, meaning no shared RAM or CPU, and you're less likely to be affected by other users.

questions.question: What is the difference between a VPS and a dedicated server?
questions.answer: A VPS is a server split into completely separate hosting environments. One of those environments is fully dedicated to you, meaning no shared RAM or CPU, and you're less likely to be affected by other users.

questions.question: Which locations are available for VPS hosting?
questions.answer: A VPS is a server split into completely separate hosting environments. One of those environments is fully dedicated to you, meaning no shared RAM or CPU, and you're less likely to be affected by other users.
